channel.title: Academic on Grünwald lab
channel.description: Recent content in Academic on Grünwald lab

item.title: Plantopia podcast interview with Matt Kasson
item.description: Healthy plants are the foundation for life on our planet. They produce the oxygen we breathe and over 80% of the food we eat. The Plantopia podcast series explains how protecting plant health can ensure a sustainable future. Inspired by the United Nations declaration of 2020 as the International Year of Plant Health, the American Phytopathological Society created Plantopia so you can explore the world of plant health in company with plant pathologists—people on a mission to protect plants and our food supply.

item.title: Welcome, Logan!

item.title: Welcoming Andrew Tupper to the lab!
item.description: Dr. Andrew Tupper joins our group as a postdoc to conduct comparative genomic approaches on P. ramorum.

item.title: Congratulations, Dr. Shakya!
item.description: Congratulations to Shankar Shakya on graduating with a Ph.D. in Plant Pathology from Oregon State University.

item.title: National Phytophthora Preparedness Workshop, Melbourne, Australia
item.description: Thanks for inviting me to give a keynote talk at the National Phytophthora preparedness workshop in Melbourne, Australia.

item.title: Open Plant Pathology (OPP) interview
item.description: OPP provides a series of interviews with scientists in Plant Pathology or related areas who have embraced open science and contributed knowledge and tools to advance the field. OPP is a community of plant pathologists, mostly computationally-oriented, that supports several forms of Open Science practices. We support efforts from individuals or groups to develop and deliver next-generation databases and tools for plant pathology-related subjects and applications using open source software, data and repositories.

item.title: CIP Workshop in Lima, Peru
item.description: Thanks for inviting me to give a seminar and workshop on our R population genetic and genomic tools during the CIP workshop ‘New tools for understanding late blight resistance and population structure of Phytophthora infestans’ in Lima, Peru.

item.title: Metacoder heat-tree wins PLoS t-shirt competition
item.description: Congratulations to Zach Foster on recognition of his metacoder package and the new heat-tree concept.

item.title: Congratulations, Zach Foster!

item.title: Ariena van Bruggen retires from the University of Florida
item.description: Ariena H. C. van Bruggen, my PhD mentor, retires from the University of Florida. I was lucky to be able to participate in her memorable retirement symposium entitled Microbial Cycling in Food Webs. The symposium was a resounding success and we all wish Ariena the best in retirement.
